definitions.text: a (usually rectangular) container; may have a lid
examples: he rummaged through a box of spare parts

definitions.text: private area in a theater or grandstand where a small group can watch the performance
the quantity contained in a box
examples: he gave her a box of chocolates

definitions.text: a predicament from which a skillful or graceful escape is impossible
examples: his lying got him into a tight corner

definitions.text: any one of several designated areas on a ball field where the batter or catcher or coaches are positioned
examples: the umpire warned the batter to stay in the batter's box

definitions.text: the driver's seat on a coach
examples: an armed guard sat in the box with the driver

definitions.text: separate partitioned area in a public place for a few people
examples: the sentry stayed in his box to avoid the cold

definitions.text: a blow with the hand (usually on the ear)
examples: I gave him a good box on the ear
